The interval of interest is from 10 to 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.

premise: The graph between 10 and 15 seconds appears to form a trapezoid.
conclusion: The area under the graph can be calculated using the trapezoid area formula.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 × (Base1 + Base2) × Height.

premise: Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, Height = 5 seconds.
conclusion: Substitute these values into the trapezoid area formula.

premise: Substitute these values into the trapezoid area formula.
The area under the graph from 10 to 15 seconds is exactly 75 meters.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is equal to 75 meters.
